subSections.title: Etymology 1
subSections.text:
First attested in the {{w|Song dynasty}} ({{zh-ref|Lü, 1940}}). Various other glyphs representing ''*mVn'' have been attested in Song dynasty texts, including {{zh-l|*懣}}, {{zh-l|*滿}}, {{zh-l|*瞞}}, {{zh-l|*門}}.

It is probably related to {{ltc-l|弭}} (in {{m|zh|[[我]]弭}}) and {{ltc-l|偉}} (in {{m|zh|[[兒郎]]偉}}) attested in the {{w|Tang dynasty}} ({{zh-ref|Lü, 1940}}); it is related to {{zh-l|每}}, as in {{zh-l|我每}}, common during the {{w|Jin dynasty}}, {{w|Yuan dynasty}} and early {{w|Ming dynasty}} ({{zh-ref|Lü, 1985}}).

Proposed etymologies:
* From the personal pronoun plural marker {{och-l|輩}} ({{zh-ref|Lü, 1985}}; {{zh-ref|Feng, 1997}}; {{zh-ref|Li, 2013}}).
* From {{ltc-l|門|door; clan; family}} ({{zh-ref|Ota, 2003}}; {{zh-ref|Yu, 1989}}; {{zh-ref|Li and Shi, 2000}}).
* From {{ltc-l|每人|everybody|id=1,1}} ({{zh-ref|Norman, 1988}}); compare {{cog|cdo|-}} {{zh-l|各儂|everybody}}, used in {{zh-l|我各儂|we; us}}, {{zh-l|汝各儂|you (plural)}}, {{zh-l|伊各儂|they}}.
* From {{ltc-l|物|thing}} ({{zh-ref|Jiang, 1995}}).

Also compare {{zh-l|*您}}.
